page.title: 04CHANGES IN SOUTH CROXTON
page.content: One way in which South Croxton has changed is in the the way the farming land is used. A local resident who we interviewed called Mr Jim Elliot, moved from Buckinghamshire to South Croxton after the second world war, in search of farmland. at that time he was a partner in a farm, but that only lasted for 2 years, and he then began to work a farm on his own. There used to be 10 dairy farms in South Croxton when Mr Elliot first moved there, but now are none. Mr Elliot also commented on the decline of the facilities and amenities in South Croxton. There used to be a limited bus service to Leicester and Melton Mowbray, but now there is no public transport. All residents are reliant on private cars now.
